title: Taxonomic Service
description: Generic concept of a Service or Tool

@id.description: The unique identifier of the Taxonomic Service object

@type.description: The type of the object, in this case TaxonomicService

schema:dateCreated.description: The date on which the Taxonomic Service was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.

schema:dateModified.description: The date on which the Taxonomic Service was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.

schema:license.description: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL

schema:availableLanguage.description: A language someone may use with or at the item, service or place. Please use one of the language codes from the IETF BCP 47 standard.

schema:version.description: The version of the Service embodied by a specified resource.

ods:topicDiscipline.description: The topic discipline relevant to the taxonomic range of the service

schema:taxonomicRange.description: The taxonomic grouping of the organism.

schema:documentation.description: URL to further documentation describing the service in more detail.

schema:ratingExplanation.description: A short explanation (e.g. one to two sentences) providing background context and other information that led to the conclusion expressed in the rating.

schema:Service.description: A service provided by an organization, e.g. delivery service, print services, etc.

schema:serviceType.description: A type that defines the kind of taxonomic service

examples: A Bombus reference collection that contains a bunch of different specimen related to the Bombus species

schema:slogan.description: A slogan or motto associated with the Service.

schema:dateModified.description: The date on which the Service was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.

schema:ContactPoint.description: A contact pointâ€”for example, a Customer Complaints department.

schema:email.description: Email address of the contact point.

schema:url.description: URL of the item that leads to the point of contact

schema:sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

schema:Maintainer.description: A maintainer of a Dataset, software package (SoftwareApplication), or other Project. A maintainer is a Person or Organization that manages contributions to, and/or publication of, some (typically complex) artifact.

schema:identifier.description: A unique identifier to identify the maintainer; ORCID or Wikidata identifiers are valid

schema:Organization.description: The organisation the maintainer is affiliated with

schema:identifier.description: The ROR identifier of the organisation

schema:legalName.description: The official name of the organization, e.g. the registered company name.

schema:FundingScheme.description: A FundingScheme combines organizational, project and policy aspects of grant-based funding that sets guidelines, principles and mechanisms to support other kinds of projects and activities.

schema:url.description: Webpage with the supported payment models and restrictions that apply to the Resource.

schema:Funder.description: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

schema:name.description: The name of the funder (funding program)

schema:SoftwareSourceCode.description: Object representing the service's software source code

schema:codeRepository.description: Link to the repository where the un-compiled, human readable code and related code is located (SVN, GitHub, CodePlex).

schema:about.description: The subject matter of the content including a summary of the Resource features updated from the previous version.
examples: A piece of software. Latest changes: upgrade of user interface, correction of minor bugs.

schema:runtimePlatform.description: Runtime platform or script interpreter dependencies (example: Java v1, Python 2.3, .NET Framework 3.0).

schema:creativeWorkStatus.description: The status of a creative work in terms of its stage in a lifecycle. Example terms include Incomplete, Draft, Published, Obsolete. Some organizations define a set of terms for the stages of their publication lifecycle.

schema:license.description: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL

schema:AssociatedMedia.description: Array of media objects that encodes this Service. This property is a synonym for encoding.

schema:contentUrl.description: Actual bytes of the media object, for example the image file or video file.

schema:license.description: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL
